meanings.definition: A fraction representing one-sixth of a whole.
meanings.sent1: She ate one-sixth of the cake, which is a sixtes of the whole dessert.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for adding a sixtes of a cup of sugar to the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The teacher divided the pizza into sixtes to teach fractions in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a sixtes of light in the darkness of his despair.
meanings.sent5: The tiny seed grew into a plant, expanding by sixtes each day.

meanings.definition: The ordinal number corresponding to the quantity of six.
meanings.sent1: She won the race by finishing in the sixtes place out of all the runners.
meanings.sent2: The store had a sale on items priced at the sixtes position in the list.
meanings.sent3: The sixtes student in line got a special prize for being patient.
meanings.sent4: His sixth birthday was celebrated with a party at the park.
meanings.sent5: The sixth star from the left shone the brightest in the night sky.

meanings.definition: A musical interval spanning six diatonic scale degrees.
meanings.sent1: The song ended with a beautiful sixtes that resonated throughout the hall.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a perfect sixtes on the piano, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The sixtes between the notes created a harmonious melody that soothed the listeners.
meanings.sent4: Her voice rose to a sixtes that echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The sixtes in the music added a touch of elegance to the composition.

meanings.definition: A unit of volume equal to one-sixth of a gallon.
meanings.sent1: He poured a sixtes of a gallon of milk into the measuring cup.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for adding a sixtes of a gallon of water to the soup.
meanings.sent3: The small bottle contained exactly one sixtes of a gallon of juice.
meanings.sent4: The sixtes of liquid filled only a portion of the container.
meanings.sent5: She drank a sixtes of the water, quenching her thirst momentarily.
